instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message: i have a MacBook (retina, 12" early2015) that has no volume. I have tried resetting the device and booting it in safe mood and have made another account to check and to all this still no avail. i waned to know what i can physically start checking on the board or int the device to see what this problem can be

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history available?
You should try known good audio board.

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message:
thank you for the reply 
We have very little history on the device, all we know is that a little bit of wine was spilled on the device at one point. Currently no audio is working even if I plug in headphones unfortunately we do not have another audio board to test on, there is nothing I can physically see wrong on the board.

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message:
Liquid spill affect audio board very easy.
Was the wine spilled on the audio board side?
You should check audio connector on the MLB and flex terminals.

I do not recommend to waste time with MLB, before testing known good audio board.

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message: We don't know too much about where it spilled. I have an audio board for this device on the way so got our fingers crossed. I also had one question if you wanted to find schematics for this board where would you be able to find them

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message: We have swapped out the audio board with a known working board and we have the same issue going on.  Do you have any suggestions on anything we should check

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message:
Look if System Report shows audio codec at least.
If not, check J6799 for corrosion.
Try another audio flex too.

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message: we just Replaced the audio board and also the cable and there seems to be no corrosion on J6799

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message: You didn't say yet if audio codec is recognized at least...

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message: Sorry I am not too familiar with the audio codec... [ATTACH type="full"]59462[/ATTACH]

threads.title: no volume(grayed out)a1534
threads.message:
Inspect J6799 for corrosion.
Be sure to get the 3 power rails at its pins.
Also check AUD_PWR_EN abd HDA_RST_L.
